('57', 443, 11, 22, 785398) MATTER S AFFECTING THEIR WELFARE.
('57', 443, 12, 23, 785432) 1. There shall be seats reserved for the Depressed Classes out of general electrorates.
('57', 443, 12, 24, 785520) Seats in provincial Legislatures shall be as follow 3 :
('57', 443, 13, 25, 785576) MADRAS 30
('57', 443, 14, 26, 785586) BOMBAY WITH SIND 15
('57', 443, 15, 27, 785606) PUNJAB 8
('57', 443, 16, 28, 785615) BIHAR AND ORISSA 18
('57', 443, 17, 29, 785635) CENTRAL PROVINCES 20
('57', 443, 18, 30, 785656) 1Vide “Message to Great Britain”, 25 9 1932. 2 The signing took place on the 24th September, at about 6 in an atmosphere of cordiality.
('57', 443, 18, 31, 785792) According to a report in The Bombay Chronicle, 26 9 1932, Madan Mohan Malaviya signed first, followed by Dr. Ambedkar, who used Rajagopala chari’s pen for the purpose and kept it for himself and in exchange gave him his own pen to sign and keep as a momento of the occasion.
('57', 443, 18, 32, 786067) 3 These figures are based on the total strength of the Provincial Councils announced in the Prime Minister’s decision.
('57', 444, 0, 1, 786186) VOL. 57 : 5 SEPTEMBER, 1932 15 NOVEMBER, 1932 445
('57', 444, 1, 2, 786236) ASSAM 7
('57', 444, 2, 3, 786244) BENGAL 30
('57', 444, 3, 4, 786254) UNITED PROVINCES 20
('57', 444, 4, 5, 786274) Total 148 2. Election to these seats shall be by joint electorates subject, however, to the following procedure:
('57', 444, 5, 6, 786387) All members of the Depressed Classes registered in the general electoral roll of a constituency, will form an electoral college which will elect a panel of four candidates belonging to the Depressed Classes for each of such reserved seats, by the method of single vote and the four persons getting the highest number of votes in such primary election shall be the candidates for election by the general electorate.
('57', 444, 6, 7, 786802) 3. Representation of the Depressed Classes in the Central Legislature shall likewise be on the principle of joint electorates and reserved seats by the method of primary election in the manner provided for in clause 2 above for their representation in Provincial Legislatures.
('57', 444, 7, 8, 787079) 4. In the Central Legislature 18 per cent of the seats alloted to the general electorate for British India in the said legislature shall be reserved for the Depressed Classes.
('57', 444, 8, 9, 787255) 5. The system of primary election to panel of candidates for election to the Central and Provincial Legislatures, as hereinbefore mentioned, shall come to an end after the first ten years unless terminated sooner by mutual agreement under the provision of Clause 6 below.
('57', 444, 9, 10, 787527) 6. The system of representation of the Depressed Classes by reserved seats in the Provincial and Central Legislatures as provided for in clauses 1 and 4 shall continue until determined by mutual agreement between the communities concerned in this settlement.
('57', 444, 10, 11, 787786) 7. The franchise for the Central and Provincial Legislatures for the Depressed Classes shall be as indicated in the Lothian Committee Report.
('57', 444, 11, 12, 787928) 8. There shall be no disabilities attaching to anyone on the ground of his
('57', 444, 12, 13, 788003) being a member of the Depressed Classes in regard to any elections to local bodies or
('57', 444, 13, 14, 788089) appointment to public service.
('57', 444, 14, 15, 788120) Every endeavour shall be made to secure a fair representation of the Depressed
('57', 444, 15, 16, 788199) Classes in these respects subject to such educational qualifications as may be laid
('57', 444, 16, 17, 788283) down for appointment to public services.
('57', 444, 17, 18, 788324) 9. In every province out of the educational grant an adequate sum shall be earmarked for providing educational facilities to members of the Depressed Classes.

('57', 445, 24, 25, 789169) INTERVIEW TO “THE TIMES OF INDIA” 2
('57', 445, 25, 26, 789205) November 10, 1932
('57', 445, 26, 27, 789223) GANDHIJI : The Zamorin does not say that it is impossible to throw open the temple but he goes on pointing out his difficulties.
('57', 445, 26, 28, 789352) If he fails in his efforts Kelappan and I have to resort to fast unless I see some flaw in the claim advanced.
('57', 445, 26, 29, 789463) In fact there is no flaw in it.
('57', 445, 26, 30, 789495) There are difficulties in the way of the Zamorin but they are not such that they cannot be got over.
('57', 445, 26, 31, 789596) The real test is whether the sanatanists, those who have the privilege of entering the temple, have any objection to untouchables entering the temple.
('57', 445, 26, 32, 789747) All the information I have received shows that the majority of the temple goers have no objection.
('57', 445, 26, 33, 789846) The whole movement is based on the belief that the temple 
('57', 445, 27, 34, 789905) 1 The signatures that follow were added to the document in Bombay at the final sitting of the Hindu Conference on September 25. 2Vide “Telegram to The Zamorin of Calicut”, 9 11 1932.

('57', 446, 1, 2, 790138) goers, i.e., sanatanists are prepared for the reform.
('57', 446, 1, 3, 790192) Our fast would be premature if they are not prepared for the reform.
('57', 446, 2, 4, 790261) Question : There won’t be any fast if the difficulties regarding the opening of these temples are removed.
('57', 446, 2, 5, 790368) Isn’t that so?
('57', 446, 3, 6, 790383) G. The proposed fast is above all for the opening of this temple.
('57', 446, 3, 7, 790449) To make it a test case Kelappan had concentrated all his efforts on this temple alone.
('57', 446, 3, 8, 790536) They have made their utmost effort to get the temple opened.
('57', 446, 3, 9, 790597) After I began my fast Kelappan also decided to follow me.
('57', 446, 3, 10, 790655) But he had not given due notice.
('57', 446, 3, 11, 790688) I pointed out this fault and advised him to postpone the fast.
('57', 446, 3, 12, 790751) He agreed to it.
('57', 446, 3, 13, 790768) Now therefore I am honour bound to fast with him.
('57', 446, 3, 14, 790818) This is the reason why we have concentrated our efforts on Guruvayur.
('57', 446, 4, 15, 790888) Q. The Zamorin says that thousands of people are willing to lay down their lives.
('57', 446, 5, 16, 790970) G. That statement of his is not true.
('57', 446, 5, 17, 791008) However, I won’t be worried if thousands of people who call themeslves sanatanists go on a fast.
('57', 446, 5, 18, 791105) Truth is more precious than thousands of lives.
('57', 446, 5, 19, 791153) I feel that a fast is a means to self purification and awakening the inner self.
('57', 446, 5, 20, 791234) It cannot be a means of coercion.
('57', 446, 6, 21, 791268) Q. Won’t this movement divide the Hindu community?
('57', 446, 6, 22, 791319) Won’t the sanatanists be separated from the rest of the Hindus?
('57', 446, 7, 23, 791383) G. I entertain no such fear.
('57', 446, 7, 24, 791412) Being a democrat, I would not oppose as I am doing now the movement known as the sanatanist movement if I am satisfied that it has the support of the majority.
('57', 446, 7, 25, 791572) The whole movement of eradication of untouchability rests on the belief that the opposition does not have a formidable support.
('57', 446, 7, 26, 791700) It is well known that it does not have any moral support.
('57', 446, 8, 27, 791758) Q. Don’t you feel that you would be more effective if you were outside?
('57', 446, 8, 28, 791830) Do you consider eradication of untouchability less important than civil disobedience?
('57', 446, 9, 29, 791916) G. I do not give anyone of them either less or more importance.
('57', 446, 9, 30, 791980) For me both are religious principles and so I cannot consider one inferior to the other.
('57', 446, 9, 31, 792069) Here I am talking about civil disobedience as a principle, not as a movement.
('57', 446, 9, 32, 792147) I cannot give any opinion on the civil disobedience that is going on the country.
('57', 446, 10, 33, 792229) Q. It seems that the movement is not as effective as it should be.
('57', 446, 11, 34, 792296) G. I cannot say that.
('57', 446, 11, 35, 792318) I am not in a position to say anything.
('57', 446, 11, 36, 792358) I cannot rely on the information gathered from the newspapers.
('57', 446, 11, 37, 792421) You should contact the workers outside.
('57', 446, 12, 38, 792461) Q. What do you say about Delhi resignations from Anti untouchability League?
('57', 446, 13, 39, 792538) G. I am not surprised.
('57', 446, 13, 40, 792561) However, I do hope there is nothing very significant behind it all.
('57', 446, 13, 41, 792629) The foundation of the League is quite strong.
('57', 446, 13, 42, 792675) It has an ideal President and a more ideal Secretary.
